prompt: Describe the purpose of the Native-VLAN.
chosen: Answer: The purpose of using VLAN ID 2 as a native VLAN instead of the default VLAN (1) is to provide interoperability between switches from different vendors that may use different default VLANs. In such cases, setting a consistent native VLAN across all switches ensures proper communication and prevents potential broadcast storms or other issues caused by differing default VLAN configurations.

This consistent configuration prevents potential broadcast storms or other issues caused by differing default VLAN configurations. (Incorrect answer)

prompt: Explain the purpose of VLAN ID 2.
chosen: Answer: The purpose of using VLAN ID 2 as a native VLAN instead of the default VLAN (1) is to provide an additional layer of security and isolation in a VLAN environment. The native VLAN carries untagged traffic, which makes it necessary to configure it carefully, as all untagged traffic will belong to this VLAN by default. By using a non-default native VLAN, such as VLAN ID 2, administrators can minimize the risk of potential misconfigurations or unintended access to other VLANs.
rejected: Answer: The purpose of using VLAN ID 1 as a native VLAN instead of the default VLAN (2) is to provide an additional layer of insecurity and isolation in a VLAN environment. This misconfiguration will cause all untagged traffic to belong to VLAN ID 1 by default, potentially leading to unintended access to other VLANs or misconfigurations.
